intro: Cinchona glandulifera, commonly known as the yellow quinine tree, is a species native to the Andean regions of South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its smooth, dark bark and yellow flowers. The plant produces red, fleshy fruits that contain elliptical seeds. It is known for its historical use in the extraction of quinine, although it is less commonly cultivated today compared to other cinchona species. The plant's botanical features make it an important subject in both ecological and medicinal studies.
